title: Girl-Prov Presents: Leave It To Beavers
description:
GET READY FOR GIRL'S NIGHT!

GirlProv is an all-female improv show, making audiences lose it with laughter at the Push Comedy Theater.

It's slumber party meets night out on the town meet sorority house party!

Don't miss this night of comedy- all made up on the spot from the audience's suggestion!

Girl-Prov: The Girls' Night of ImprovSecond Friday of the month at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 8, tickets are $5



Push Comedy Theater763 Granby Street Norfolk, VApushcomedytheater.com

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.
full_description:
GET READY FOR GIRL'S NIGHT!

GirlProv is an all-female improv show, making audiences lose it with laughter at the Push Comedy Theater.

It's slumber party meets night out on the town meet sorority house party!

Don't miss this night of comedy- all made up on the spot from the audience's suggestion!

Girl-Prov: The Girls' Night of Improv
Second Friday of the month at the Push Comedy Theater
The show starts at 8, tickets are $5


Push Comedy Theater
763 Granby Street
Norfolk, VA
pushcomedytheater.com

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

title: Teacher's Pet
description:
The Students Become The Masters!!!

Teachers and students will join forces for a good old fashioned improv jam!!!

Don't miss it! Some of the Push Comedy's Theater's funniest students share the stage with their teachers, The Pushers. Ordinarily we frown upon fraternization between teachers and students... but for one night only all bets are off!!!

Teachers Pet

Second Friday of the month at 10pm

Tickets are $5



The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There‚Äôs been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world‚Äôs greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You‚Äôll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that‚Äôs played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn‚Äôt your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

title: Second Saturday Stand-Up
description:
Second Saturday Stand-Up

This once-a-month show is hosted by almost-jaded veteran comic Hatton Jordan who sets the lineup with proven comedians delivering road-tested jokes while they squeeze in new material.

This is NOT a "open mic" .....it's selected talent working on their craft. Every month is a new seasoned lineup.

Every show 90 minutes.

Host: Hatton Jordan

Line up: Robert Taylor, Matthew Carter, Natalia Alvarez, Sherri Priester, Adrienne Mayfield plus Special Guest



Second Saturday Stand-Up

Saturday, July 13h at 10pm

Tickets are $5

title: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
description: The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!Comedy dies in darkness.The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss! Featuring special comedy guests: The Dumpster Dudes!WHAT IS IT???Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!WHO IS IT???The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the group‚Äôs bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!Guests:The Dumpster Dudes Sketch ComedyWHEN & WHERE IS IT???The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!Sunday, July 14th @ 7 p.m.Push Comedy TheaterTickets $10 at door or online:Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!
full_description:
The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!
Comedy dies in darkness.

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy group brings their non-stop energy to the Push Comedy Theater stage for a live comedy show that you do not want to miss! Featuring special comedy guests: The Dumpster Dudes!

WHAT IS IT???

Sketch comedy: Ever seen SNL, Mad TV, Key & Peele? Crazy scenarios, weird props & costumes, bizarre characters! The only difference: You are in the live audience!

Improv comedy: Chicago-style long form improv. Don't worry, it's nothing like Chicago-style pizza. It's actually good! The Bright Side gets one word from the audience and uses it to make up an entire set of hilarious scenes on-the-spot!

WHO IS IT???

The Bright Side Sketch & Improv Comedy is a group of four friends - Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, Andrea Bourguignon, and Drew Richard - formed in 2015 from the Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their particular brand of comedy is a celebration of the absurdity of the mundane world. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects the group‚Äôs bizarre, unrelentingly optimistic perspective. Look on The Bright Side!

Guests:
The Dumpster Dudes Sketch Comedy

WHEN & WHERE IS IT???

The Bright Side: A Live Sketch & Improv Comedy Show!!
Sunday, July 14th @ 7 p.m.
Push Comedy Theater
Tickets $10 at door or online:


Come out to see and support one of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of the new Norfolk Arts District!

title: Sketch Comedy Writing 201
description:
This is where it gets real!!!!

This course builds upon the fundamentals and skills learned in 101. The class will focus on developing comedic characters, parody and building their own, unique show

At the end of the session, students sketches will be performed on the Push Comedy Theater stage by some of Hampton Roads finest actors.

This class will be held from 6:30-9:30pm on Wednesday nights.

July 17th thru August 14th at the Push Comedy Theater.

This is a 5 week class.  Students are encouraged to bring sketches and sketch ideas to the first class.

Price: $175



$60 for students taking Sketch 201 a second time.

title: Class Dismissed: The Musical Improv 101 Graduation Show
description:
Come cheer on Push Comedy Theater‚Äôs Musical Improv Class as they take the stage for their graduation show!

This talented band of improvisers has been working incredibly hard for 6 weeks - singing, rapping, and even dancing - so let‚Äôs support them as they show us their brand new skills.

Get ready as singing and improv collide!!!

Class Dismissed: The Musical Improv 101 Graduation Show

Wednesday, July 17th at 8pm

Tickets are $5

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Harold Night

Free show!!!

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.



--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The 5 ‚ÄúArtists‚Äù You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)
description:
The 5 ‚ÄúArtists‚Äù You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

You could pay $11 for a decent meal and you would poop it out later and your $11 will be gone forever. BUT you could pay $11, change a life just by meeting some artsy people and not resent your poop.

If you went to Art Grad School you met these people.

If you didn‚Äôt go to Art Grad school but you shared a campus with them, you met these people.

If you‚Äôve ever seen art on a coffee shop wall or a poster about their upcoming art show on a coffee shop wall or ever just walked into a coffee shop with a coffee shop wall you‚Äôve met these people in one way or another.

You don‚Äôt have to be an artist to meet artists. You‚Äôve met them already. You can meet them all over again from the safety of an audience seat (and somewhere other than a coffee shop).

This one-woman show will isolate and re-introduce those 5 artists that you met (or didn‚Äôt meet) (or haven‚Äôt met yet), poke fun at itself and at the artists portrayed in each category of the contemporary artist.

Disclaimer: the artist working today and not necessarily just contemporary art (as in the movement) because who has ever actually MET contemporary art or a movement in a coffee shop?

Despite these 5 artist‚Äôs best efforts to be the unique, non-conforming individualist, what unites them is that everybody is really unique in their own artsy way. This one-woman show will let you see inside their uniqueness. (and maybe into yours)

(Art Grad School Graduate Disclaimer about being the unique, non-confirming individualist: in grad school it‚Äôs very rare that anyone actually wants to sit down with you in your ‚Äústudio‚Äù, listen to you drone on about your craft and why this piece is working or that piece isn‚Äôt working while sipping overpriced coffee from a bodega. It‚Äôs even more rare that they occasionally mumble thought-provoking questions in the abstract under their breath while you stammer and stumble about, grabbing sketches of this or that and shuffling through drawings while being fueled by anxiety and a need for a nugget of feedback on who you are and what your work means.)

Sorry, but nobody does that anymore. But we ‚ÄúArtists‚Äù try anyway. Out here grinding, y'all.

<Value Add Statement added for effect and also a Call to Action>

If you pay $11 for this performance, you will come away with empathy for the actress as she continually embarrasses herself. This show will make you feel better about your life, maybe forever.

Whether you‚Äôre a 9 to 5‚Äôer in a secure job with paid over time and benefits or a post art grad school person, or a self-educated artist or just a creative in general, if you are a really successful lawyer or business owner- it doesn't matter what you do. This show will make everyone appreciate parts of themselves and their lives.

You‚Äôre going to like the way you feel, I guarantee it. (but also no refunds, so‚Ä¶)

The 5 ‚ÄúArtists‚Äù You Meet In Grad School (As told by Heidi Peelen)

Friday, July 19th, 8pm

Tickets $11

title: ComicKaze presents No Nudity (This Time): A Sketch Comedy Show
description:
ComicKaze Sketch Comedy has heard you loud and clear! We know you love sketch comedy and hate rampant public nudity.

We promise that when you come to THIS show, you will see many hilarious comedy scenes and, as opposed to any ComicKaze show past or future, absolutely zero instances of flagrant full-frontal nudity, GUARANTEED!

So if you love to laugh, and definitely do not want to see bare nipples, exposed buttocks, or pendulous genitals, we‚Äôll see you at Push Comedy Theater on July 20th!

ComicKaze: The comedy you deserve.

ComicKaze presents No Nudity (This Time): A Sketch Comedy ShowSaturday, July 20th at 10 PM | $10

----------

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

So if you love to laugh, and definitely do not want to see bare nipples, exposed buttocks, or pendulous genitals, we‚Äôll see you at Push Comedy Theater on July 20th!

ComicKaze: The comedy you deserve.

ComicKaze presents No Nudity (This Time): A Sketch Comedy Show
Saturday, July 20th at 10 PM | $10

----------

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.
Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

title: Hot Summer Nights with Improv Riot and Left Swipe
description:
Get ready for a summer full of comedy!!!

The last Thursday of the month we'll be pairing a Push Comedy Theater favorite with something brand new.  New groups, new performers, new styles of improv... all for just $5.  It's a night of tried and true vets and young comedy upstarts.  Don't miss it.

This month:

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.

---

Left Swipe

Remember that weird first date you had? The one with the girl that was sexy and funny and turned you on in a way that made you question your manhood? The one that had so many red flags she could have been a socialist country? Yeah that one. Left Swipe is like her.

Left Swipe is made up of 4 young and super hot Hampton Roads gals who will make you laugh so hard you‚Äôll wanna marry us without signing a prenup.
full_description:
Get ready for a summer full of comedy!!!

The last Thursday of the month we'll be pairing a Push Comedy Theater favorite with something brand new. New groups, new performers, new styles of improv... all for just $5. It's a night of tried and true vets and young comedy upstarts. Don't miss it.

This month:

The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show

Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.

You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.

---

Left Swipe

Remember that weird first date you had? The one with the girl that was sexy and funny and turned you on in a way that made you question your manhood? The one that had so many red flags she could have been a socialist country? Yeah that one. Left Swipe is like her.

Left Swipe is made up of 4 young and super hot Hampton Roads gals who will make you laugh so hard you‚Äôll wanna marry us without signing a prenup.

title: The Improvised Fairy Tale: A Kid Friendly Comedy Show
description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an ‚ÄúImprovised Fairy Tale.‚Äù  Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!‚ÄúThe Improvised Fairy Tale‚Äù is part of the Children‚Äôs Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm.  The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.
full_description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an ‚ÄúImprovised Fairy Tale.‚Äù Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!

‚ÄúThe Improvised Fairy Tale‚Äù is part of the Children‚Äôs Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm. The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.

title: ‚ÄãhomeGROWN
description:
homeGROWN

by rebekah rickards

The self appointed DIY, macaroni necklace, KWEEN of comedy makes her PUSH COMEDY debut with an hour special of leather-car -seat- HOT sketches, engorged with music, DANCE, and XXLarger than life characters serving as the fluorescent jelly to this delicious, comedy-filled donut.

Don‚Äôt slip, just slide, through PUSH COMEDY to see this dance-comedy extravaganza!



homeGROWN

Sunday, July 28 @ 7:00pm

Tickets: $10



Rebekah Rickards:

Virginia Beach native, Rebekah Rickards, has been a dance educator, choreographer, and comedic performing Artist for over a decade. Having studied, performed and choreographed work along the East Coast, predominately Philadelphia and New York, Rebekah proves to be a strong, collaborative voice with a passion for originality through innovation. She works full time as a freelance performer, producer, and choreographer, most recently touring her solo comedy show; ‚ÄúHOMESHOW! Fail to Win, a Losers Journey‚Äù. Her artistic voice continues to find connections between her various expressions of interests including; dance, comedy, film, storytelling, and shared human experience.

title: Kink with a Wink (8pm Show)
description:
Kink with a Wink...

A flirtatious, fun and funny exploration of sex.

Give yourself permission to open your eyes to something titillating. (You can cover your eyes if it‚Äôs just too naughty for your Victorian eyes) Consent to expand your imagination to possibilities. (If other things expand that‚Äôs ok, too) Submit yourself to what can be fun and funny about sex and human behavior. (Are you giggling at yourself or the OH MY! moments in front of your eyes) Dominate your deepest inner thoughts. (Crack the whip on yourself if you‚Äôre feelin froggy)

In this interactive show you will help us explore desire through music, movement, conversation and artistic expression. Together we will find our shared connections and view the ‚Äúrisqu√©‚Äù lives of others from a different, and open, viewpoint. Perhaps they‚Äôre not as risqu√© as we may think. Maybe ‚Äúnaughty‚Äù is just another version of nice. Do you want the freedom to be naughty? Do you just wanna watch, you naughty thing?

In America, there‚Äôs nothing funny about sex ... or is there?

What we find out will be our little secret.

Feel free to sweat. Feel free to avert your eyes. Feel free to lean in. Feel free to find yourself. Feel free to take a cold shower afterwards ... you may just need it üòâ

Kink with a Wink

August 17th, 8pm

Push Comedy Theater

Tickets are $12

***it goes without saying, this show is for a mature audience.

title: We Hartley Knew Her-An SNL Style Comedy Show
description:
The Pre Madonnas invite you to our final sketch comedy show.   With Evan Hartley moving to Chicago, this will be our last curtain call together.

Prepare yourself for, "We Hartley Knew Her," a celebration of four years of friendship, laughter, and inappropriateness.   We will dust off sketches old and new for this special occasion.Our community's loss is Chicago's improv scene's gain.  This show is a display of not only our love for her but for you and everyone else that has supported us.  Come see the "Best of Hartley" and...a few more surprises that we've created these last four years!
full_description:
The Pre Madonnas invite you to our final sketch comedy show. With Evan Hartley moving to Chicago, this will be our last curtain call together.


Prepare yourself for, "We Hartley Knew Her," a celebration of four years of friendship, laughter, and inappropriateness. We will dust off sketches old and new for this special occasion.

Our community's loss is Chicago's improv scene's gain. This show is a display of not only our love for her but for you and everyone else that has supported us.

Come see the "Best of Hartley" and...a few more surprises that we've created these last four years!
